title: OKYRHOE
content:
OKYRHOE (Ocyrhoe) was a Naiad-nymph of the river Kaikos (Caecus) in Teuthrania (north-western Anatolia). She
        was loved by the god Hermes and bore him a son named Kaikos for whom the local river was named.

KAIKOS (by Hermes) (Pseudo-plutarch On
          Rivers 21)

R. E. Bell, Women of Classical Mythology (sourced from Pseudo-Plutarch On Rivers 21)
          : 
        "A nymphe loved by Hermes, she bore him a son Kaikos (Caecus) who threw himself into the River Astraios
        (Astraeus) which was thereafter called Kaikos."

Other references not currently quoted here: Pseudo-Plutarch On Rivers 21.

A complete bibliography of the translations quoted on this page.
